node.title: 'Where is she? Is she safe?': Concerns for Chinese tennis player who claimed politician sexually assaulted her
node.alt: A woman looks at a tennis ball as she throws it
node.description: The WTA says the Chinese government must conduct a full investigation into sexual allegations made by tennis star Peng Shuai against a former senior Chinese official.
node.content:
["The Women's Tennis Association (WTA) has called for a full investigation into sexual assault allegations made by Chinese tennis star Peng Shuai against a former senior Chinese official.", "Earlier this month, in a social media post that was later deleted, Ms Peng accused the former official of forcing her into sex following a round of tennis several years ago.\u00a0", "In the original post, Ms Peng\u00a0said she could not provide evidence to back her allegations and said she had later had an on-off consensual relationship with the man.\u00a0", "The post\u00a0on leading Chinese social media platform Weibo was removed around half an hour after it was published, but screenshots were shared among private WeChat groups.\u00a0", "Ms Peng is one of China's biggest sporting stars, and a\u00a0two-time grand slam doubles champion.\u00a0", "In a statement, WTA chairman and chief executive Steve Simon called for a \"full, fair and transparent investigation\" into the allegations, while also demanding an end to the censorship of Ms Peng.", "\"The recent events in China concerning a WTA player, Peng Shuai, are of deep concern,\" Mr Simon said.", "China's internet is heavily censored and the private lives of top leaders are an especially sensitive subject.", "The man accused by Ms Peng\u00a0retired in 2018 and has largely disappeared from public life,\u00a0as is usual with former Chinese officials.", "", "
Ms Peng was the first Chinese player to achieve a top ranking.(Reuters:\u00a0Toby Melville)
", "
Disappearance fears prompt social\u00a0media campaign\u00a0
", "Ms Peng has not been seen or heard from since the social media post, prompting concerns among the global tennis community.", "Activists, fans and fellow players, including American great Chris Evert, French player Alize Cornet and British player Liam Broady\u00a0have taken to social media to share\u00a0the hashtag\u00a0#WhereIsPengShuai in support of Ms Peng.", "\"This is serious; where is she? Is she safe?\" Ms Evert said.", "Ms Peng was the first Chinese player to achieve a top ranking, becoming the world number 1\u00a0doubles player in 2014\u00a0after winning the doubles titles at Wimbledon in 2013 and the French Open in 2014.", "She was also a semi-finalist in singles at the US Open in 2014.", "Her accusation was the first against a prominent Chinese government official since the #MeToo movement took hold in China in 2018 before being largely tamped down by authorities the same year.", "ABC/wires"]
